alert.note: Alert for Southeastern Brooks Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 09 at 9:30AM AKDT until July 09 at 9:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Including the following area, Southeastern Brooks Range. This includes the cities of Arctic Village, Wiseman, Coldfoot, Chandalar Dot Camp, And Iniakuk Lake. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy showers over the Southeastern Brooks Range on Friday night and Saturday dropped up to one inch of rain over steep terrain. Creeks and small rivers in steep terrain are running high and some could see flood today. Larger rivers are rising today, but at this time it is uncertain if larger rivers will flood. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood People in the Brooks Range should be alert to the possibility of rising water levels along creeks and rivers today.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
